channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump to meet with top congressional leaders Monday ahead of government shutdown deadline at midnight on Wednesday
item.description: Democrats, believing they have leverage, have insisted on key health care provisions in exchange for their votes.

item.title: A Man Is Linked to the Brutal ‘Yogurt Shop Murders’ 34 Years Ago
item.description: Police said they used DNA to identify a suspect in the Austin killings known as the yogurt shop murders. The case has haunted the city for decades.

item.title: Giuliani and Dominion Voting Systems Settle $1.3 Billion Defamation Suit
item.description: The election technology company Dominion Voting Systems had accused Rudolph W. Giuliani of waging “a viral disinformation campaign” over the 2020 elec...

item.title: Inside the Trump Administration’s Push to Prosecute James Comey
item.description: President Trump’s campaign of retribution began to intensify in mid-July and hit a fever pitch over the last week, culminating in the indictment of on...

item.title: Entrepreneurs can make up to 70% more than paid employees per year, but there’s high inequality among the self-employed
item.description: But "the typical dollar in self-employment does not come from the typical self-employed individual," according to a Minneapolis Fed study.

item.title: Des Moines Schools Superintendent Arrested By ICE Is Placed on Leave
item.description: School Board members in Iowa’s capital made the decision one day after immigration officials accused the superintendent, Ian Roberts, of being in the ...

item.title: Trump asks Supreme Court to back his limits on birthright citizenship and upend how the 14th Amendment’s been interpreted for 125 years
item.description: Any decision on whether to take up the case probably is months away and arguments probably would not take place until the late winter or early spring.

item.title: U.S. revokes visa for Colombia’s president after he went to a protest and urged American soldiers to disobey Trump
item.description: During a protest Friday over the war in Gaza, he said “I ask all the soldiers of the United States' army, don't point your rifles against humanity" an...

item.title: Iranians Brace for Economic Impact of New U.N. Sanctions
item.description: Already suffering a 40 percent inflation rate and critical shortages of power and water, many in Iran expect conditions to get worse.

item.title: Denmark reports drone sightings at military facilities as NATO warns Russia about violating airspace
item.description: In neighboring Germany, several drones were reported in the northern German state of Schleswig-Holstein, which borders Denmark, from Thursday into Fri...

item.title: Jerome Cohen, Lawyer Who Saw a Future in China, Dies at 95
item.description: After pioneering the study of Chinese law in America, he was among the first foreigners to practice commercial law in China, and spoke out about human...

item.title: Iranians Brace for Economic Impact of New U.N. Sanctions
item.description: Already suffering a 40 percent inflation rate and critical shortages of power and water, many in Iran expect conditions to get worse.

item.title: Outages to Government Services Continue After Fire at South Korean Data Center
item.description: Hundreds of state services were still offline the day after a lithium battery exploded during maintenance work at a data center, officials said. The f...

item.title: U.S. Ambassador to Israel Is Expected to Make Rare Visit to Egypt
item.description: Ambassador Mike Huckabee is to travel to Cairo for talks that officials said would focus on the Gaza war and tensions between Israel and Egypt.

item.title: Stampede at Actor’s Political Rally Kills at Least 36 in India
